medical_history.chief_complaint: Diffuse, sharp abdominal pain localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 2pm yesterday, with the initial diffuse abdominal pain eventually localizing to the RLQ by the next day. There has been a poor appetite since the onset of pain, but the patient was able to consume some soup the morning of the evaluation. She reports feeling chills, with no fever and regular non-bloody stools. There are no associated symptoms such as nausea, vomiting, dysuria, or pelvic pain.
